comments.commentBody:
You're being sarcastic, right? "This" has gotten completely out of hand? Not collusion with the Russians to derail our elections? The dots are connecting so fast
my head is spinning.

"only in Cleveland"

It's becoming like "didn't inhale."
Citizen, that is Right and let us remember that We also have a Tax-Free President!

A.G. Jeff Sessions - after his riff with Al Franken during the Senate judiciary Committee's confirmation hearings - averred that he "did not have communications with the Russians". Lies and mendacity - Sessions did see Kislyak, Russia's friendly Ambassador to the US in Cleveland, and had met with the Ambassador in his Senate office 2 months before the election. But Sessions walked back his denial by claiming he was "just confused". That's what we need - a "confused" Attorney General. Pixy Jeff recused himself "as any good attorney general should do" (good? give us a break).

The Russian connection to Donald Trump and his empire has not been plumbed with the transparency we would hope - Transparency being swamp murk muddying Sherlock Holmes's "investigative tool", his magnifying glass. And remembering the excruciatingly long Congressional investigations into Benghazi, surely there should be investigations about Russia's ties to our 45th President. 'Connecting the dots' and 'crossing the Ts and dotting the Is' are stupid memes. But in the case of our President's strange ties to Putin's Russia, we the people need to know what was going on as Russia despoiled America's 2017 Preidential Election and threw a last minute Comey/FBI monkey wrench into Hillary Clinton's failed presidential campaign. We await the news from you, dear Gail, with bated breath and curiousity. And we're not thinking about Cleveland, either. As Al Franken said, "yeah, it's kind of troubling".

I appreciate, Gail, your effort to shine a light on the naked emperor (of the no clothes variety) but where were you and your colleagues when it came to light that Russians had hacked into the Democratic emails?  I am not the sharpest knife in the drawer but my immediate thought was that maybe the naked emperor (to be) had something to do with that.  I remember the videotape of NE (naked emperor) talking about his relationship vis a vis Putin.  Now all I see is videotape of NE denying he hasn't called Russia in 10 years.  Come on Gail, get out in front of all this stuff.
Attorney General Jeff Sessions lied under oath.  That is the issue at hand.
All things sized or size-like, sizable, or spray sizing are of interest to mister small hands.  Whom I voted for because the other choice was for the ignorant.

With prayers of gratitude, Ms. Amy...
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4equB-uSjHc

You have helped us all touch the divine with this love story. May you have peace, serenity, and be surrounded with abundant love as you move towards the end of this journey, knowing that you have touched and inspired so many....

Unlike the earlier poster, I am almost 50 and still haven't found my life partner. But as another person here suggested, your shoes are far too large to fill. You brightened my child's bookshelves and early childhood with the likes of Little Pea, and you made me howl with laughter a long time ago with your early works for adults. I wish you peace. I wish your family peace and comfort.

I recognize a "Charleston" way of handling things in the last comment!  Having recently lost my wonderful husband, this article spoke to me in a very personal way.  Even though he didn't use his considerable talents as a wordsmith to recommend me to a future partner, he did something better.  Near the end of his life, he told me that I was the best thing that had ever happened to him.
I am so very sorry.

Very touching article.  Having watched my brother in law lose his wife at 51 last year, I was confronted with the thought of losing my wife.  My sister-in-law died of breast cancer, the same cancer my wife had just recently survived. I knew iwhat it was like to even think of losing her and then to watch  someone else close die of the cancer she survived was intense.

North Korea's rapidly escalating nuclear capability is perhaps the most alarming issue the entire world is facing. In this era of deep division within our country, which borders on ideological civil war, it is most important that we not let fears of "normalizing" this president prevent us from supporting him in efforts to thwart this horrible threat. In this context, the ominous directive "divide and conquer" speaks volumes.
Swiss--I don-t think trump will ever work with China.  He's made himself a pariah to them.  THEY have shown restraint, because they understand the situation.
tony--I'm not sure "certain annihilation" is a concern in NK.
Marvinsky--Boy, howdy, did you hit THAT nail on the head! He appears to be interested in doing harm to many of our own citizens.

Your hate is not strong enough to overcome real love, Titian. Strange that you read this essay all the way through, then commented on it. You took Amy's expression of love into your brain, and now it's in you, no matter what hate you spew out. Try to enjoy your day!
You need to read more.
Is the flag on the second of the two large mobile missile transporters in the first photo, Chinese?
No, it is not. Good joke, however.

Do we really want to be discussing strategy and policy regarding on of the great evils of the world, on the front page of the NY Times?  Because surely North Korea reads this publication--and why not???...it's the most supportive of their government--and the most critical of ours.

The U.S. has been trying to sabotage or circumvent the North Korean nuclear program for years - this is certainly known to Kim Jong-um so there is no reason not to discuss it.

But conservatives favor secrecy for the good reason that they have so much to hide - like Trump's tax returns, for example, or all their secretive conversations with Russians.

Yes, absolutely. Sure, the government of North Korea (and every other country on the planet) will read something they already know. However, this the great thing about our society; a free press, which allows our people the same right (except for Top Secret (which this is not) to be made aware of many things.

To be clear, you KNOW North Korea and numerous other countries have strict control over what it's own people read and it is highly censured.

No I guess such basic strategy and decision making by our leaders should be secret and kept from the American public. They have no right to know or discuss it. Only let the public know what the leaders want them to know. Security above democracy.
Sounds like the reasoning used by the leaders of Russia, China and..North Korea!
Be nice and add the translation?...Please?  Pretty please?
It won't happen! - North Korea with a ballistic missile or our President with a thought?

Just barely though - the war machine back then wanted war so very bad.  It might just have come down to a Russian sub commander's brave 'Nyet' against the order to use nuclear torpedoes that saved the world.

Dear Amy, You see all of your husband's attributes and list them so fondly, but I can also see so much of you in that list: without someone to savour the procured wine and cheese, would he have so much enjoyment cooking the dinner? How sweet that he surprised you with a coloured gumball, but how lovely it was that you were so delighted each time. It is you I see in all those lines, not just your husband, and I hope you are so proud of the life you have created. You have three children who clearly admire and love their father, and you. You have been a shining role model of someone who nurtures and treasures a long-term relationship. You did good. And on top of that: I can see your adventurous soul, your delight in spontaneity. And beyond that: I have loved your works for so long, and have been so nourished by your words. I am sorry you have to leave so early, but am glad that you get to leave so much. Still, too early, and that is a great, great shame.
So let me get this right. We are building a wall at the Mexican border to keep out all those bad dudes from North Korea?

Yup... it's the new New Frontier.

But only makes sense to some primitive swamp animals who live in a command bunker in Washington far from North Korea, Mexico, Iran and other threatening European countries, and are mostly concerned with attacking on all imaginary domestic fronts at once.

We need a bit more imagination from The Leader. Can't he move the swamp to the Rio Grande or drain the wall or something?

Not dudes. Nukes.

The Big Wall will stop them, too!
Last week the Times showed that North Korea has the ballistic capability to reach most of the planet.  We are truly doomed with two mentally ill rulers--one here and one in Pyongyang--at the helm.

There is one huge difference: the failure rate of North Korea's Musudan missiles is 88%. That is 7 out of 8.

Consequently, even if successfully fired (which it has a 1 in 8 chance of), it would still have to get through an absolute plethora of ground-to-air and air-to-air missiles before it got even a small portion of the way to the US.

Other countries, namely Japan, and even China would be in much more danger.
Maybe he is just a fabulous guy. And maybe, she has been special for appreciating what a fabulous guy he is. Why do you think he would not be fabulous if not for her?
